meanings.definition: Extremely fine or delicate in texture or quality.
meanings.sent1: The baby's skin felt superfine to the touch.
meanings.sent2: The artist used superfine brushes to create intricate details in the painting.
meanings.sent3: The superfine thread was so delicate that it tangled easily.
meanings.sent4: Her superfine taste in art made her a sought-after collector.
meanings.sent5: The superfine sand on the beach sparkled in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: Of very high quality or grade.
meanings.sent1: The chef prepared a superfine meal for the special occasion.
meanings.sent2: The superfine fabric of the dress made it stand out among the rest.
meanings.sent3: His superfine manners impressed everyone at the party.
meanings.sent4: The superfine craftsmanship of the watch was evident in every detail.
meanings.sent5: The superfine wine was a delight to the connoisseurs' taste buds.

meanings.definition: A type of flour that is very finely ground.
meanings.sent1: The recipe called for superfine flour to achieve a smooth texture.
meanings.sent2: The baker sifted the superfine flour to ensure no lumps remained.
meanings.sent3: The superfine flour clouded the air as she poured it into the mixing bowl.
meanings.sent4: The cake turned out perfectly with the addition of superfine flour.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of the superfine flour filled the kitchen as it baked in the oven.
